Articles.Content:
I feel like I'm losing my mind here. If I take a fuel tank, put an engine on the bottom, then radially attach a couple fuel tanks on the side of the center tank, then the single engine in the middle should draw fuel from all three tanks, without needing fuel lines or anything, right? No decouplers or girders or anything involved, just 3 tanks and an engine. Mine's not using the side tanks. Is this a known issue or anything?

Edited October 20, 2013 by lewisd

That's not how it works, the fuel logic looks at the center stack first and stuff that's radially attached are separate stacks, they'll need fuel lines if you intend to use a single engine. In which case it'd be best to attach them by radial decouplers and drop them once they're dry.

If you are playing career mode, you probably do not have them yet - then you could use up the fuel in the center stack and transfer fuel from the radials by alt-right-clicking two tanks.

Watch out to balance out the weight! ;p Would be best to use smaller tanks on the outside so you can refill the center tank by simply emtying two small ones into it, still you will have to use/empty your radial tanks symmetrically.

(Career mode actually managed to make TAC Fuel Balancer a "cheaty" mode ... )
